actor_awards.notes: One of the few performers to achieve the 'Triple Crown of Acting' (Oscar, Emmy, and Tony). She won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her film debut in 'Come Back, Little Sheba', reprising her Tony-winning stage role. She is also widely remembered for her Emmy-winning title role in the television series 'Hazel'.

filmography.title: Come Back, Little Sheba
filmography.role_description: A frumpy, delusional housewife trying to cope with her recovering alcoholic husband and the loss of her youth.
filmography.plot: A housewife's drab life is shaken up when she takes in a young female boarder who reminds her husband of the girl he once loved.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Drama; Cannes Film Festival: Win – International Award - Best Dramatic Actress

filmography.title: About Mrs. Leslie
filmography.role_description: A boarding house owner who reflects on her long-term, secret romance with a wealthy, married man.
filmography.plot: A woman reminisces about her relationship with a mysterious aircraft manufacturer she met years ago.

filmography.title: The Matchmaker
filmography.role_description: A meddlesome but well-meaning matchmaker who decides to capture the heart of a wealthy merchant for herself.
filmography.plot: A matchmaker tries to arrange a marriage for a wealthy merchant but decides to marry him herself.

filmography.title: Hot Spell
filmography.role_description: A housewife who tries to hold her family together as her husband drifts away and her children grow up.
filmography.plot: A housewife tries to keep her family together despite her husband's midlife crisis and desire to leave.

filmography.title: The Year Without a Santa Claus
filmography.role_description: The voice of Santa's capable wife who takes charge to save Christmas when Santa falls ill. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: When a weary and discouraged Santa Claus considers skipping his Christmas Eve run one year, Mrs. Claus and his elves set out to change his mind.

filmography.title: The Glass Menagerie
filmography.role_description: A faded Southern belle who relentlessly pushes her children to achieve the success she feels she missed. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A son longs to escape his stifling home life, where his mother worries about the future of his shy, disabled sister.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role in a Drama

filmography.title: Do Not Fold, Spindle or Mutilate
filmography.role_description: An elderly woman who, along with her friends, creates a fake profile for a computer dating service as a prank, attracting a psychopath. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Four elderly women create a fictional young woman for a computer dating service, but their prank turns deadly when a serial killer responds.

filmography.title: Main Street to Broadway
filmography.role_description: She appears as herself in this star-studded look at the theater world.
filmography.plot: A young playwright tries to write a hit for Broadway, encountering many famous stars along the way.

filmography.title: The Smugglers
filmography.role_description: An American tourist in Europe who gets entangled in a smuggling scheme. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Two American tourists in Europe become the targets of smugglers who have hidden contraband in their luggage.
